subject: Re: Abjads
msgSnippet: Paul, Your shorthand or speed script is easy enough to read but then the phrase you used is not exactly a transcription challenge. Would you like a more
messageBody:
Paul,

Your shorthand or speed script is easy enough to read but then the
phrase you used is not exactly a transcription challenge.

Would you like a more challenging test?

The easiest sounds to cut are @ and ^ except when they are onsets or
when they follow a consonant cluster such as frm [f'rm or fr'nm]

Caps can be used for digraphs if you don't like digraphs or letter
markers. In unigraphic ENgliS, it woul be written:

in uDr wRdz, it lvkt sumTN lYk Dis, but av kors UzN D speSl keratrz
insted v dYgrqfs.

PF: n idhr wrdz, it lkt smthng lk dhs, bt v krs yzng dh spshl krktrz
instd v dgrfs

There is a cut or abbreviated version of ENgliS for texting.

REF: bottom of this page:
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/saundspel/files/Franklin/famous-
quotes.html

If you find ENgliS easy to read, I would like to suggest it as an
alternate ASCII keyboard for QuickScript.

I would also like a fontographer to build a digital version of
Goody's SSA phonemic script.

Steve

--- Paul Fox wrote:

n idhr wrdz, it lkt smthng lk dhs, bt v krs yzng dh spshl krktrz
instd v dgrfs

Paul,

Your shorthand or speed script is easy enough to read but then the 
phrase you used is not exactly a transcription challenge.

Would you like a more challenging test?

The easiest sounds to cut are @ and ^ except when they are onsets or 
when they follow a consonant cluster such as frm [f'rm or fr'nm]

Caps can be used for digraphs if you don't like digraphs or letter 
markers.  In unigraphic ENgliS, it woul be written:

in uDr wRdz, it lvkt sumTN lYk Dis, but av kors UzN D speSl keratrz 
insted v dYgrqfs.

PF: n idhr wrdz, it lkt smthng lk dhs, bt v krs yzng dh spshl krktrz 
instd v dgrfs

There is a cut or abbreviated version of ENgliS for texting.

REF: bottom of this page:
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/saundspel/files/Franklin/famous-
quotes.html

If you find ENgliS easy to read, I would like to suggest it as an 
alternate ASCII keyboard for QuickScript.

I would also like a fontographer to build a digital version of 
Goody's SSA phonemic script.  

Steve
